A sanctuary for honest men. Or An abstract of humane wisedome Contayning, a certaine way leading to a perfect knowledge of Man, and directing to a discreet cariage in the vvhole course of our humane condition. Collected and composed by Io: Hitchcock student in the Middle Temple. Hitchcock, John, student in the Middle Temple.
[8], 181, [11] p.
Printed by Edward Griffin for Thomas Norton at the signe of the Kings head in Paules Churchyard, London : 1617.
A moral discourse. Running title reads: The abstract of humane wisdome. Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
